title: Spanish Robbery Thriller 'You Would Do It Too' Trailer from Apple TV+
description: "Would you hide the truth for justice?" Apple TV has unveiled an official US trailer for a Spanish mystery thriller series called You Would Do It Too, created by David Victori and Jordi Vallejo. This crime series comes from Spain and it already debuted streaming in Spain and Mexico a year ago. Apple just caught up with it now and will send it streaming in the US on Apple TV+ soon. An armed robbery takes place on the bus line that connects the airport with several cities near Barcelona. The result? The three dead robbers, a wanted person, and six witnesses can't identify the fugitive. Why won't they talk? As they navigate a world where perception often trumps reality, this thriller shines a spotlight on the importance of truth in today's society and the lengths people will go to protect their own version of it. Starring Ana Polvorosa, Michelle Jenner, Pablo Molinero, and José Manuel Poga. These kind of twisty crime and murder, who-did-it / why, series are pretty popular in the US, too. Which is why I think Apple ...
author: Alex Billington

text: TRAILERS by October 16, 2024Source: YouTube "Would you hide the truth for justice?" Apple TV has unveiled an official US trailer for a Spanish mystery thriller series called You Would Do It Too, created by David Victori and Jordi Vallejo. This crime series comes from Spain and it already debuted streaming in Spain and Mexico a year ago. Apple just caught up with it now and will send it streaming in the US on Apple TV+ soon. An armed robbery takes place on the bus line that connects the airport with several cities near Barcelona. The result? The three dead robbers, a wanted person, and six witnesses can't identify the fugitive. Why won't they talk? As they navigate a world where perception often trumps reality, this thriller shines a spotlight on the importance of truth in today's society and the lengths people will go to protect their own version of it. Starring Ana Polvorosa, Michelle Jenner, Pablo Molinero, and José Manuel Poga. These kind of twisty crime and murder, who-did-it / why, series are pretty popular in the US, too. Which is why I think Apple hopes this will catch on with US audiences as well, wondering what's going on with this bus robbery. Who is this strange savior guy anyway? Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Apple TV+'s series You Would Do It Too, direct from YouTube: Tú También lo Harías takes place after an armed robbery on a bus near Barcelona results in the deaths of three robbers. Detectives and former lovers are on a mission to uncover the truth behind the six witnesses' inconsistent timelines before time runs out in the legal process. As they navigate a world where perception often trumps reality, this lightning-fast thriller shines a spotlight on the importance of truth in today's society and the lengths people will go to protect their version of it. You Would Do It Too, also known as Tú También Lo Harías in Spanish, is a series created and written by acclaimed Spanish writers / filmmakers Jordi Vallejo ("La Riera", The Pact, Cross the Line, El Test, Harlan Coben's "The Innocent") and David Victori (The Pact, Cross the Line, "Sky Rojo"). With episodes directed by David Victori & Víctor Cuadrado. Made by Legendary Television, Espotlight Media, and Crea SGR. Executive produced by Jordi Vallejo, David Victori, and Anxo Rodriguez. It already debuted in Spain last year. Apple will release You Would Do It Too streaming on Apple TV+ in the US starting October 30th, 2024 coming soon. Anyone want to watch this? Find more posts: Foreign Films, Streaming, To Watch, Trailer prev next
html:
TRAILERS

by
October 16, 2024
Source: YouTube

"Would you hide the truth for justice?" Apple TV has unveiled an official US trailer for a Spanish mystery thriller series called You Would Do It Too, created by David Victori and Jordi Vallejo. This crime series comes from Spain and it already debuted streaming in Spain and Mexico a year ago. Apple just caught up with it now and will send it streaming in the US on Apple TV+ soon. An armed robbery takes place on the bus line that connects the airport with several cities near Barcelona. The result? The three dead robbers, a wanted person, and six witnesses can't identify the fugitive. Why won't they talk? As they navigate a world where perception often trumps reality, this thriller shines a spotlight on the importance of truth in today's society and the lengths people will go to protect their own version of it. Starring Ana Polvorosa, Michelle Jenner, Pablo Molinero, and José Manuel Poga. These kind of twisty crime and murder, who-did-it / why, series are pretty popular in the US, too. Which is why I think Apple hopes this will catch on with US audiences as well, wondering what's going on with this bus robbery. Who is this strange savior guy anyway?

Here's the official trailer (+ poster) for Apple TV+'s series You Would Do It Too, direct from YouTube:

Tú También lo Harías takes place after an armed robbery on a bus near Barcelona results in the deaths of three robbers. Detectives and former lovers are on a mission to uncover the truth behind the six witnesses' inconsistent timelines before time runs out in the legal process. As they navigate a world where perception often trumps reality, this lightning-fast thriller shines a spotlight on the importance of truth in today's society and the lengths people will go to protect their version of it. You Would Do It Too, also known as Tú También Lo Harías in Spanish, is a series created and written by acclaimed Spanish writers / filmmakers Jordi Vallejo ("La Riera", The Pact, Cross the Line, El Test, Harlan Coben's "The Innocent") and David Victori (The Pact, Cross the Line, "Sky Rojo"). With episodes directed by David Victori & Víctor Cuadrado. Made by Legendary Television, Espotlight Media, and Crea SGR. Executive produced by Jordi Vallejo, David Victori, and Anxo Rodriguez. It already debuted in Spain last year. Apple will release You Would Do It Too streaming on Apple TV+ in the US starting October 30th, 2024 coming soon. Anyone want to watch this?
